characters: WHERE FEAR IS Y UR ONLY FRIEND
WELCO E TO SP ORY ISLAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A full moon pokes a white hole in a black sky. 0.S. we hear FESTIVE ROCK ‘N ROLL and the WHOOPS and HOLLERS of JOYFUL REVELERS. We PAN DOWN TO Spooky Island, a tropical island/theme park. This cheesy tourist trap is hardly a Disneyland or Magic Mountain, nor even, sad to say, a Legoland. Like Rome, it was not built in a day. Unlike Rome, it very well likely could have been. We PASS a colorful Fiberglass “haunted" castle that sits atop a small mountain. We PASS palm trees and huge papier mache heads impaled on stakes. We APPROACH a lit sign that reads: °

dialogues.speaker: WHERE FEAR IS Y UR ONLY FRIEND
dialogues.text: We MOVE PAST the sign and OUT OVER a crowd of college students. Dancing. Partying. Pouring beer on themselves and each other. Men in skeleton costumes pounce out of the shadows frightening nary a soul. We MOVE TO a film crew following a pretty, peppy REPORTER. The Reporter walks through the young people. We MOVE WITH her. She speaks loudly to be heard over the revelry.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Students the world over are trading in the sandy beaches of Florida for a completely different Spring Break experience here on Spooky Island! The Reporter arrives at a large-breasted LASS in a bikini.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: What’s your name?

dialogues.speaker: LASS
dialogues.text: Barbara!

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Has your experience here on Spooky Island been, well, spooky?

dialogues.speaker: LASS
dialogues.text: Last night I threw up five times! That was kinda whacked! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We MOVE ON, PAST cardboard gravestones wobbling in the WIND. PAST island natives -- that is, employees of various ethnicities wearing grass skirts and war paint -- holding a limbo stick for students. PAST a hunchback boinking giggling visitors with a plush hammer. We ARRIVE AT a rocky mountainside, where a young, sullen- looking woman, ISABEL ROGERS, sits on the stoop of a fake gallows. Isabel is "Goth." She wears all black. Her hair is dyed black and gelled into tall spikes. Her eyes are circled by thick, dark rings of makeup. Two fat, sweaty students slam their hairy bellies together in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: This place sucks. Isabel’s friend MANDY stands beside her, peering through a tiny window on a door that reads "STAFF ONLY." The door leads into the mountainside. Mandy is a pretty, fresh-faced blonde with a pierced nose.

dialogues.speaker: MANDY
dialogues.text: No dizz-oubt. I can’t see nothing. Mandy tries the doorknob. It’s not locked.

dialogues.speaker: MANDY
dialogues.text: Whoa. Hey, Isabel, come on.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Why would you want to go in there? Mandy enters the staff doorway.

dialogues.speaker: MANDY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Better than frat central out here. Isabel looks around nervously. She slips in behind Mandy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mandy and Isabel peer down a long stretch of a dark cavernous hall. We hear WATER DRIPPING.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Weird. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MANDY
dialogues.text: They should let us come in here, man. S’way scarier than those Silence of the Lambs bumper boats. Isabel and Mandy creep down the hall. They discover an adjoining hallway to their right. Planks of wood cover the rocky walls. Mandy heads down it.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Mandy, let’s go back, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel follows Mandy down the hall. After a moment, Isabel looks behind her. A pair of fiery red eyes are staring at them.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Mandy... Mandy turns around. She sees the eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MANDY
dialogues.text: Ha! It’s another one of those animatronic demon thingama-whats! Mandy struts down the hall and toward the eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MANDY
dialogues.text: They want us to come in here! It’s set up to be part of the- park! Mandy gets closer and sees what’s actually standing there. Her expression drops.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: MANDY
dialogues.text: Run!! Mandy twirls around. She starts to dash, but something in the dark grabs her. She falls to her belly. She screams. Isabel sees her yanked back, disappearing into the darkness. The SCREAMING STOPS. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel takes off down the hall. The eyes follow her. The hallway ends in a "T." Isabel darts left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel flees from the fiery eyes. Large wooden doors line the hall on both sides. She spots red eyes approaching in front of her as well as behind. She tries one door. Locked. She tries another. It swings open. She throws herself inside. .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel slams the door behind her. She clamps a wooden slab in place, locking it. She turns. The enormous CREATURES SLAM on the door. A phone sits on a desk. She picks it up. Dials. Sobs. O.S. the PHONE RINGS. An ANSWERING MACHINE PICKS UP.

dialogues.speaker: GARRET, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: You have reached the Rogers residence. Please leave a message at the beep. Beep! No, not that one -- ha ha! This one: The MACHINE BEEPS.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Daddy, please pick up! Some type of demon is chasing me! It just got Mandy! Please, Daddy -- The DOOR SHATTERS beside her. Isabel screams. She drops the phone and runs through another door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel slams shut another door behind her. Deadbolts it. She turns. She sees: . The walls of the room are plastered with newspaper clippings, magazine articles, and photographs. She looks quickly from one to the other:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: reads, "TEENAGE SLEUTHS REVEAL BLACK KNIGHT GHOST AS HOAX." A photo pictures the Mystery, Incorporated gang: Shaggy Rogers, Fred Jones, Daphne Blake, Velma Dinkley, and the huge Great Dane, Scooby-Doo.

dialogues.speaker: MAGAZINE HEADLINE
dialogues.text: reads, "MYSTERY INC. SOLVE ENIGMA OF JUMPING GHOST CLOWN: Springs on Bottom of Shoes." There is a photo of the gang with the aforementioned shoes.

dialogues.speaker: POSTER AD
dialogues.text: with Scooby-Doo and a cyclops monster eating Scooby Snacks reads: "Scooby and the Cyclops have this mystery solved: Scooby Snacks are DELICIOUS!"

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Isabel stares at the articles, confused, and whispers:

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Scooby-Doo? The DOOR CRASHES down. Isabel screams in horror. The SCOOBY-DOO THEME SONG begins.

dialogues.speaker: START CREDIT SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: The CREDIT SEQUENCE is a MONTAGE of historical records: PANS of magazine and newspaper articles, old Tv footage, and interviews documenting the rise and fall of Mystery, Inc. The following are some of the snippets for inclusion:

dialogues.speaker: TV FOOTAGE
dialogues.text: A Host stands on a colorful, Peter Max-ish studio set for a cheesy variety show.

dialogues.speaker: HOST, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Now, as promised, the four young detectives who defeated the Black Knight Ghost! The audience applauds wildly. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HOST, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Fred Jones! -

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE, (IN A COLORFUL, GROOVY FONT)
dialogues.text: Fred Jones jogs down a set of stairs. He’s a handsome teen with a healthy blonde mane. He wears a white sweater and a red ascot. He gives thumbs-up.

dialogues.speaker: HOST, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Daphne Baker!

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: Daphne Blake, a gorgeous redhead, trots down the other side. She waves. She wears an eggplant and pink outfit and a lime scarf.

dialogues.speaker: HOST, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Shaggy Rogers!

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: Shaggy Rogers runs down another set of stairs. He is a skinny teenage dude, with a scruffy goatee and a messy mop of hair. He wears a green T-shirt and brown boot-cut corduroys. He holds his arms up in triumph.

dialogues.speaker: HOST, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Velma Dinkley!

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: Velma Dinkley, a stocky tomboy, walks out modestly. She wears thick spectacles that distort her eyes and an orange cowl-neck sweater. She smiles politely and nods.

dialogues.speaker: HOST, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And Scooby-Doo!

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: Here comes Scooby, leaping like a joyous idiot onto the stage. He’s the familiar tongue-wagging canine we know and love, brown with black spots, gargantuan, goofy, and gangly. He slides toward us happily until he realizes he’s sliding toward the edge of the stage. He panics, trying to stop himself, but is unable. He falls into the front row. Scooby’s head pops up amongst the crowd. He chuckles his trademark laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The headline reads: "MYSTERY INC. STOPS HEADLESS HORSEMAN’S WAVE OF MAYHEM WITH FIRE HOSE." It features a grainy photo of the gang spraying a fire hose at the "Headless Horseman“ on his white mare. TV FOOTAGE - INT. “TONIGHT SHOW" SET The gang sits on the couch beside Jay Leno.

dialogues.speaker: JAY LENO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Tell me, how'd you know this headless horse-guy wasn’t real?

dialogues.speaker: FRED, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I noticed the upper half of his body was too large for his frame. No one’s built like that. There was room for a whole head up there.

dialogues.speaker: JAY LENO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hal Perceptive!

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Freddy’s so like all a genius! The audience applauds. Scooby bows. Velma looks upset.

dialogues.speaker: INTERVIEW
dialogues.text: VELMA, like the rest of the gang in these PRESENT DAY interviews, is a few years older, in her early twenties.

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: I was the one who noticed the Headless Horseman’s body was too big. And I sat there thinking, now Jay Leno will believe it was Fred, forever.

dialogues.speaker: GRAINY TV FOOTAGE
dialogues.text: The gang is mobbed by teen fans seeking autographs.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN BEAT COVER
dialogues.text: Dreamy photo of an airbrushed Fred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Photo of Daphne, pretty and sweet in a purple, pink, lime flowered dress. -

dialogues.speaker: PC GAMING COVER
dialogues.text: Photo of Velma. Headline: "Velma Dinkley’s Gaming Tips."

dialogues.speaker: CREEM COVER
dialogues.text: Photo of Shaggy jamming on a guitar.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: They like treated me like their personal slave. Finally I said, hey, I’m a detective!

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: I said, if you’re a detective, then name one thing you’ve detected!

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: So I said, okay -- I detect that the only thing you’re good for is getting captured and tied up by bad guys! How’s that!?

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: (teary-eyed) I couldn’t believe he’d say that to me.

dialogues.speaker: VARIETY COVER
dialogues.text: Headline: "FAMOUS DOG INKS SIX FIGURE DEAL TO HAWK "SCOOBY SNACKS" with a black and white headshot of Scooby.

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: I know Scooby’s a dog and - everything, but even considering all that he’s a moron.

dialogues.speaker: COMMERCIAL OUTTAKES
dialogues.text: A closeup of Scooby-Doo. He grins and holds up a bag of Scooby Snacks (TM).

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ren I’m rungry I reat Rooby Racks!

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Cut! Mr. Doo, you must enunciate.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Rooby rat rar rurry ren err--

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Cut! I couldn’t understand a bloody word he said.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER TAKE
dialogues.text: Scooby looks angry. He speaks without passion.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Ren I’m rungry Roob Racks --

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Cut! Dammit!

dialogues.speaker: US MAGAZINE COVER
dialogues.text: Heading: “MYSTERY INC. DEBUNKED! Teen Sherlocks call it quits after three troubled years," featuring a photo of the gang in happier days.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: There comes a time to separate the wheat from the chaff. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FRED (CONT’D) The four of them are wheat and I’m the chaff. (beat) Of the other way around. Whichever is the good one, that’s the one I am.

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: So finally I quit.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: I said, I’m out of here, okay?!

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Rood-rye and rood riddance!

dialogues.speaker: . SHAGGY
dialogues.text: To paraphrase Johnny Mathis, I said, ‘Take this job and shove it!’ I mean, I like didn’t say it right then. But I thought of it later, and, boy, I wished I had. END CREDIT SEQUENCE. EXT. SHAGGY’S HOUSE - NIGHT Rain falls on this ramshackle, gray, suburban home. The lawn is overgrown. The roof is caving in. The gutter hangs. Duct tape keeps a cracked window in place. O.S., a PHONE RINGS. INT. SHAGGY’S KITCHEN A rotary phone sits on a counter crowded with dirty pots and pans. Drops of RAIN PLINK against a window behind it. The PHONE RINGS again. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A dog’s front paw picks up the receiver. Scooby-Doo brings the phone to his ear. He yawns, sleepy-eyed. He’s just woken up. The rain on the window projects curling shadows onto the fur of his face.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Rello?

dialogues.speaker: GARRET, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Scooby! ?

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. Rooby reaking.

dialogues.speaker: GARRET, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (erying) This is Shaggy’s Uncle Garret. It’s my daughter, Isabel. I got a call from her on Spooky Island -- Scooby’s eyes flood with fear.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Rooky! ?

dialogues.speaker: GARRET, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: She claimed she was being chased by some sort of demon -- !

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Remons?! Scooby slams down the receiver, hanging up on Garret. He stares at it, fearfully. The PHONE RINGS again. Scooby picks it up, attempting a Spanish accent:

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Hola!?

dialogues.speaker: GARRET, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Scooby, I’m not an idiot! I know this is you!

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: El robody-o rame-o el Roobido here. Scooby hangs up the phone again. He paces back and forth. Dog whines. Bites his nails. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It RINGS again. Scooby picks it up as if it were a dead pet. He holds the receiver a few inches from his ear.

dialogues.speaker: GARRET, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Put my nephew on the phone! He’s -- Scooby looks up to see a dark shape stumbling out of the bedroom toward him.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Scooby-Doo... where are you? Shaggy Rogers stumbles into the bedroom doorway. He is in his green T-shirt and tightie-whities. He scratches his butt. He squints to shut out the light. 7

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Who is it? Scooby quickly hangs up the phone, futilely hoping Shaggy won't notice.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Robody.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Come on, man. Like I just watched you on the phone. Scooby shakes his head, denying it. He’s a total liar. THUNDER CRACKS. The PHONE RINGS. Shaggy reaches for the phone. Scooby jumps to block him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Coolsville campus is nearly abandoned for spring break. A couple kids play Frisbee with a golden retriever. INT. GARRET ROGERS’ OFFICE PROFESSOR GARRET ROGERS weeps. He is a stout man with glasses too small for his bald skull. He sits in an ergonomic chair. A framed photo of Shaggy and Isabel, smiling with their arms slung over each other’s shoulders, is propped on his desk. Advanced degrees cover his walls. A nervous Scooby and Shaggy are seated with him. A tape recorder plays on his desk. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Some type of demon is chasing me! It just got Mandy! Please, Daddy -- We hear the DOOR SHATTER; ISABEL SCREAMS, the PHONE DROPS; the LINE GOES DEAD. Garret hits the stop button.

dialogues.speaker: GARRET
dialogues.text: The police won’t do anything! They said it’s a haunted theme park, it’s normal for people to get panicked calls!

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: When’s Isabel supposed to get back?

dialogues.speaker: GARRET
dialogues.text: At the end of spring break. A week from tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Maybe we should like wait until --

dialogues.speaker: GARRET
dialogues.text: No! Something strange is going on. These Spooky Island reps won’t let me speak to my own daughter. Garret pushes forward two open Coolsville U yearbooks on his desk.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: What’s this?

dialogues.speaker: GARRET
dialogues.text: I’ve done some research. These three students all went to the Island last year. Three students’ photos are circled in pencil. Angel Fawn is a Mohawked-punk rocker. Andrew Cozine is a black rapper with wraparound sunglasses and shapes shaved in his hair. Floyd Pepper is a Deadhead wearing a tie-dyed shirt.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: These yearbooks belong to the library! You could get in trouble for drawing on them! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Garret shows them two newer yearbooks next to the old ones. The same students’ pictures aré circled. Angel’s hair is now blonde and permed. Andrew sports glasses and a bow tie. Floyd is a crew-cutted jock. They are all smiling, happy and conservative.

dialogues.speaker: GARRET
dialogues.text: These are their pictures from this year, since they’ve returned.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: zoinks.

dialogues.speaker: GARRET
dialogues.text: In addition to their appearance, their G.P.A.’s have risen dramatically. They were formally disciplinary problems, but no longer. Angel, she edits the school paper. Floyd’s become the quarterback for the Coolsville Flower Powers... What do you think it could be?!

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: It’s probably... a magic potion. Garret grips tightly to Shaggy’s forearm, breaking down. Fluids drip from his nose.

dialogues.speaker: GARRET
dialogues.text: A magic potion? Dear Lord! Shaggy, you have to go to Spooky Island! You have to find Isabel! You have to solve this mystery!

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Uncle Garret, stuff from your nose is touching my arm!! Shaggy yanks his arm away.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: I don’t know how to do a mystery --

dialogues.speaker: GARRET
dialogues.text: You were a profession detective for four years!

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I wasn’t, you know, like paying attention! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Garret places some cash on the table.

dialogues.speaker: GARRET
dialogues.text: My savings. Do whatever you need to find my baby princess. And I have something here for Scooby, if he’1l go with you.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Ro way! Garret pulls a bag of Scooby Snacks (TM) out of a vase.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Rooby Racks?! Scooby rolls over on the carpet like a nincompoop. He knocks over an end table and lamp. Garret looks at Shaggy.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: He’s doing tricks. That’s rolling over. Scooby unsheathes a display sword from the wall over the desk. He pretends to repeatedly stab himself by jabbing the sword in his armpit. He falls onto his back.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Playing dead.

dialogues.speaker: GARRET
dialogues.text: Scooby, the whole bag is yours if you go to this Spooky Island and find my daughter. Scooby stands.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Rokay! I’11 rill the remons!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby slashes the sword, growling ferociously.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Uncle Garret, Fred and Velma figured out everything. I was just the guy that carried their bags.

dialogues.speaker: GARRET
dialogues.text: Then get your friends to come along. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: We haven’t spoken in two years.

dialogues.speaker: GARRET
dialogues.text: Please. You love Isabel as much as I do. Shaggy stares compassionately at his uncle. It’s obvious he does love his cousin. Just then, Scooby, pretending to be a swashbuckler, accidentally slices Shaggy’s shoulder with the sword.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: OQw!! Why are you playing with a sword?! Scooby points at Garret.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Re did it.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: No, he didn’t! I was looking at him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to the 28th Annual Coolsville Science Fiction Convention. Awkward fan boys, middle-aged men dressed as superheroes, and B-movie starlets in skimpy femalien costumes cross in front of a placard outside an auditorium. The placard reads:

dialogues.speaker: COOLSVILLE ASTRO-CON PRESENTS
dialogues.text: FRED JONES, discussing his new book, E.S.P./Schmee. S.P.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRED JONES at a podium. He holds a remote control. Only ten or so bored fans sit in the large auditorium.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: And then there was the time, of course, when I solved the mystery of -- Fred presses the remote, flashing a... Slide of a phony seaweed monster. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: -- the seaweed-covered ghost,~ exposing him as... Fred clicks to a slide of the seaweed-covered ghost, unmasked. Slide Slide Slide Slide

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: ++. aman in a mask. of the Aztec ghost, chasing Shaggy.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: The Aztec ghost was quite a challenge until I discovered -- of the Aztec ghost, unmasked.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: That he was a man in an Aztec ghost mask. of the abominable snowman ghost.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: But I guess you’d say I’m most remembered for revealing to the world that the abominable snowman ghost -- of the abominable snowman ghost, unmasked.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Was actually a man inside of a ma. Kk. BOY raises his hand.

dialogues.speaker: FAN BOY
dialogues.text: Do you think there’s such a real thing as a real ghost?

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: My new book, E.S.P./Schmee.S.P., addresses that issue, my friend. After years of investigating supernatural claims I have arrived at one utter and unassailable conclusion: There are no such entities as ghosts, ghouls, goblins, or monsters. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: At the end of every paranormal claim there are only fools seeking fame, paranoid imaginations, or charlatans looking to make a buck. There is absolutely -- absolutely -- no suc’ hi: as magic in this world. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Any other questions? A maladjusted FAT KID raises his hand.

dialogues.speaker: FAT KID
dialogues.text: Yeah. Why do you suck? The other kids in the auditorium crack up. Fred smiles, blushes, attempts to be a good sport, when he spots... Shaggy and Scooby in the rear of the auditorium. Scooby waves excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Shagster?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred sits with Shaggy and Scooby. The yearbooks and a tape recorder are in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Well, it’s obvious some sort of man in a mask apprehended your cousin. The important question is... What kind of mask?

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: So you’1l go with us?

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Can’t, Shag. My book tour. Tomorrow I’m off to Evanston, I --

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: But what about these pictures?

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: It’s either a coincidence, or they all got jobs at Disneyland. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Or a magic potion.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Shaggy. There is no such thing as supernatural phenomena.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Like you’re leaving out the proven entities, right?

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Such as?

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Leprechauns.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Ralking relerons!

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Yeah, walking skeletons.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Rankenrerries.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Right, Fr -- No, Scoob. Frankenberry’s a guy on a cereal box. (to Fred) Right? He’s not a real guy, is he? Fred is struck by an idea.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: It could be a hypno-wheel.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Those red-and-white twirly things that make you act like a chicken?

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: (nodding) Amnesty International has declared hypno-wheels a violation of basic human rights, ever since Pol Pot employed one during the Khmer Rouge. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Think of it, Fred! That’d be the kind of thing that could get a guy, like, global press. Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Out of rinky-dink fan conventions and back on Leno. INT. PSYCHOLOGIST’S OFFICE A group sits in a circle of chairs. A PSYCHOLOGIST reads from a list on her clipboard.

dialogues.speaker: PSYCHOLOGIST
dialogues.text: Velma Dinkley... Why don’t you tell us why you enrolled in group therapy? Velma Dinkley is within the circle. She has a difficult time sharing her feelings.

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: My fellow students in the Ph.D. mathematics program told me I was...

dialogues.speaker: PSYCHOLOGIST
dialogues.text: Bitter?

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: I was in a group for a long time where I didn’t get the credit I deserved. No one noticed me, and...

dialogues.speaker: PATIENT
dialogues.text: What was the group?

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: (mumbling) Mystery, Incorporated.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENT
dialogues.text: The guys with the big dog?

dialogues.speaker: PSYCHOLOGIST
dialogues.text: Scooby-Doo?

dialogues.speaker: PATIENT
dialogues.text: Right! And Fred Jones. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Velma nods, uncomfortable, half-attempting a smile.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENT
dialogues.text: Yeah! They had that chick, Daphne.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENT
dialogues.text: Oh my God, she was hot! She was Bo hot!

dialogues.speaker: PATIENT
dialogues.text: Which one were you?

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: Velma... She just said my name a second ago.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENT
dialogues.text: I don’t remember a Thelma. EXT. PSYCHOLOGIST’S PARKING LOT - LATER Velma exits the office with the other patients. She doesn’t socialize. She heads to her Dodge. She hears a CAR HONK. And turns. The colorful Mystery Machine van is here. It’s rusted, beaten, and faded. Fred, Shag, and Scoob wait in it.

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: Jinkies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Velma sits in the parked van with Shaggy and Fred.

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: Where’d you find the Mystery Machine?

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: I tracked it down on eBay a couple years back! I charge fans fifteen bucks for a ride around the block. An angry Scoob is tightly crossing his arms in the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with him? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: He’s still miffed you called him a moron when we were breaking up.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Well, Scoob, you have to admit -- relatively speaking, measured against a human, you are a moron. Scooby, offended, snatches a notebook off the back seat. He furiously writes something on it.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: So, Velma, are you in? This’1ll be a real doozy of a news story if all five of us go.

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: On one condition. When we announce the hypno-wheel to the press, I take the TV interviews. Scooby shows the notebook to Velma, to prove that he’s not a moron. It reads: 12 +7

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: That’s not right. Scooby fiddles with the equation. Fred looks at Shaggy.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: But it’s tradition that I do that.

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: Fine. Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Breaking tradition, that’s like... hanging turds on a Christmas tree.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: I rid rat once.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Don’t remind me, Scoob! Velma sits, saying nothing, staring forward.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Well... Heck, all right. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Fred ruffles Velma’s hair like a little kid. She angrily slaps his hand away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby, Shaggy, Velma, and Fred cross the garden toward a dojo. Scooby is still writing in the notebook. A sign reads "TAI CHI ACADEMY."

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: Okay, when we get in there, just follow my lead. Daphne’s not going to want to go because of Fred.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Why? She digs me. Scooby holds up the notebook again: 12 +7

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: No. Velma opens the door. A martial arts match is occurring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daphne, in a dashing eggplant karate robe with a lime belt, is taking on numerous students at once. An INSTRUCTOR watches. She karate chops an attacking Asian student in the neck. Two students hurl themselves toward her. She somersaults over them. She downs one with a swipe to the spine and another with a heel to the kidney. Daphne stands frozen, crouched, her fist out in front of her in Flying Lotus stance. The students lie in mangled pain around her.

dialogues.speaker: INSTRUCTOR
dialogues.text: Excellent, Daphne-san. You are learning to harness your chi. They hear clapping. Daphne turns to see the gang. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? - (to Fred) Especially you?

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Hey. Don’t be sharp just ‘cause Freddy gave you the heave-ho.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: (to Fred) Re ras rinky.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: I was stinky?!

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Clingy. He said you were clingy.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: I broke up with you, Freddy!

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: Mystery Ink is reforming.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Yippee. My answer’s no way!

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: I understand. Let’s go, guys. Everyone, following Velma’s lead, starts to leave. This startles Daphne.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Where are you go -- What do you mean, ‘you understand?’

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: It’s easy for us. But for you, always getting captured and tied up, always having to be saved by someone else. I can see where being the damsel in distress is humiliating.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: But I’m not like that anymore! I’ve slowly kind of turned my body into sort of a dangerous weapon! Velma smiles patronizingly. She and the others exit. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Daphne stands, agonized, torn. She beats her hands against her forehead, Annette Bening-style. Then she succumbs.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Dammit. Wait!

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: A plane takes off overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daphne stands with Velma.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Those guys are gonna look like total, total idiots when they’re captured and then I’m the one that’s saving them!... Scooby, hold still! She's putting lipstick on a distracted Scooby. He wears a gray wig, floppy bonnet, and a pair of teardrop, jewelry-studded glasses. Daphne holds an old lady's driver’s license up beside his face.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: What do you think? Does he look like my grandma-ma? Velma stares without expression at Daphne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred wheels his luggage to a list of TWA departure times. The board lists flights to L.A., St. Louis, New York, as well as one flight to Spooky Island, leaving at 4:10.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: expertly plays a fifty cent crane machine. The grabber grips a stuffed dragon. Shaggy guides it into the slot. Hoots triumphantly. Spots Fred.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Fred! Check out all these things I wont! Pred eyes a pile of stuffed creatures beside Shaggy. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Cool. Where are k.d. lang and Malibu Barbie?

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Disguising Scooby. Like, ‘cause if he has to ride in a kennel he gets all claustrophobic. Fred, horrified, sees something down the hall behind Shag.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: is having a heck of a time staying upright in high heels. Daphne helps him walk. His body wavers and jerks. A YOUNG BOY and his MOMMY pass Scooby. The Boy points.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BOY
dialogues.text: Mommy, what’s wrong with that lady? Mommy smiles at Scooby. She speaks out of the side of her mouth while shoving her son’s pointing finger down.

dialogues.speaker: MOMMY
dialogues.text: Be nice, Larry. She has a disease. Daphne whispers to Scooby.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Good boy. Just keep your balance. They arrive at Shaggy and Fred. A pleased Scooby freakishly grins and gives them the thumbs-up.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Rooby rockin’ good!? Velma won’t look directly at him.

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: Make him cut that out. It’s creepy. Fred theatrically throws his palm downward in the middle of the gang. The others stare at him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: What? -

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Before we get on the plane, let’s do that thing where we put our hands on top of each other, then lift them up and go, ‘Whoo hoo!’

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Rokay! Scooby puts his paw on Fred’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Roo _ hoo!

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Wait for everybody, Scoob.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Rorry. Fred stares at the others, pumped up, grinning widely.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: I’m not going to do it unless Velma and Shaggy do it.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: People are watching. Velma shakes her head a little and grimaces. The three of them walk away. Fred and Scooby stand alone, their fake smiles fading, their hands on top of each other.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Roo hoo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An AIRPORT CLERK collects tickets at the gate. Passengers file by.

dialogues.speaker: AIRPORT CLERK
dialogues.text: Please have I.D. ready with your ticket! Daphne shows the Clerk her driver’s license. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Clerk nods, rips her ticket, and Daphne passes through. - Shaggy, peering nervously back, gives him his ticket and ID. The Clerk rips his ticket, and Shaggy passes through. Scooby hands the Clerk his ticket and ID. The Clerk looks at the photo of Daphne’s grandmother. Scooby, pretending to have no teeth, does a melodramatic senior citizen voice.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: I’m a rittle old rady! The Clerk stares at him. Velma, behind Scooby, explains.

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: Since that photo my grandmother’s contracted acromegaly. (whispered) The Elephant Man disease. The Clerk nods sympathetically. He rips the ticket.

dialogues.speaker: AIRPORT CLERK
dialogues.text: God bless you, ma’am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane soars over the sunset and wispy clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: College students abound, many of them tattooed punks and Goth rockers and hippies. Scooby, Shaggy, and Fred sit across the aisle from an upper crust coed. Scooby notices a cat in a Sherpa bag in the space at the feet of the coed. The CAT HISSES at him. Scooby, still dressed as the old lady, growls. His lip rolls up. The coed gives Scooby an uneasy look.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: (sotto voce) Scooby, cut it out. Scooby stops. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Rorry. 7 Fred has hypno-wheel notes and diagrams on a tray in front of him. But he ignores them for a moment, staring longingly at Daphne, who sits a couple rows down.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: You still have like a thing for her, don’t you? Fred looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Daphne.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: That’s ludicrous.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Then what’s this? Shaggy points to some doodles next to Fred’s notes: hearts that read "Fred + Daphne 4ever," and the like, and poorly-drawn pictures of Daphne. Fred scrambles and shuts it.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Don’t be touching my private things! The CAT HISSES at Scooby again. Scooby loses it, barking at the cat. Everyone looks at the barking old lady.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Scooby!

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Shaggy, it’s simple behavior modification. To cause a dog to discontinue any action, you flick him on the nose. Observe. Scoob? Scooby turns to Fred.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: When you bark, this is what happens. Fred flicks Scooby on the nose. Scooby stares a moment. Then he punches Fred eight times in the face, hard.  30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang and students descend a stairwell from the plane. Scooby tears away his disguise, and gazes out at: A cobblestone walkaway leads from the plane onto this eighth-rate Disneyland. Natives line the walkway. They vend skull key chains, T-shirts, and plastic leis formed to resemble intestines. LOUDSPEAKERS emit SCARY MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Okay, gang, let’s spread that photo of Isabel around, see if anyone knows her. Then we’ll see if we can locate the hyno-wheel. The gang fans out at the bottom of the stairg. They each have a photograph of Isabel, which they show to the natives. Daphne stands with one EMPLOYEE.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: She came in last week. Isabel Rogers. Have you seen her?

dialogues.speaker: NICE NATIVE, (EMPLOYEE)
dialogues.text: Boy, I’d like to help. But I haven’t. Sorry. Shaggy shows a picture to N’GOO TAUNA, a large, friendly albino wearing a slick suit. N’Goo has a strange accent. N’GOO No, I do not recognize her. Is this your dog? N’Goo looks at Scooby-Doo. Shaggy nods. N’GOO It is unarguably the most beautiful animal I have once held eyes on!

dialogues.speaker: ENTHUSED NATIVE
dialogues.text: May I... pet your dog!? Shaggy shrugs. The natives gather around Scooby, cooing and awing as they pet him. Scooby digs the attention, but is a bit ticklish. N’Goo looks at Shaggy. N’GOO I am N’Goo Tauna, the proprietor of the Island’s hotel. You come along in my cart. I drive the Werewolf! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A line of golf carts wait at the end of the walkway. Each cart is adorned with a different monster theme: the Mummy, Dracula, King Kong, a Smurf, etc. (monster theme = a paper-mache monster head on top of the cart).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: N‘Goo drives the Werewolf cart down the cobblestone pathway. Gaudy animatronic statues loom on either side of the lane. The statues are weathered, with parts chipped away: Famous monsters, cheesy ghosts in sheets, and skeletons missing bones. They chomp and grab at passersby. The gang is crowded together in the cart. Fred and Velma sits the front seat with N’Goo. The rest are in back. N’GOO You come here to face the demons?

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: Yes. And afterwards we’re going to Pirates of the Caribbean to stop the horrible mutilation going on there. N’GOO Ha ha! One who is doubting!

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: We’ve come here to disprove your demons. I’m an author. Fred Jones. N’GOO Mm. Rings no bells.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Perhaps you know one of my books: The Bermuda Triangle, What Crap, or Bigfoot: Bulls: - N’goo shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: I’m very famous in the U.S. Scooby, in the back seat, buries his face in Shaggy’s chest.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: It’s okay, Scoob. They’re only machines. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Scooby peers up and sees an animatronic Frankenberry chomping on the bloody arm of a dead tittle girl. Scooby screams at the top of his lungs.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Isn’t that... the cast of ‘Friends’? It is indeed an animatronic cast of "Friends." Eating a dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The golf carts pull around a stone altar and a circular stone platform. Weeds poke through the platform's eracked surface. In the center of the platform is a large stone bowl covered with carvings of demons. The gang gathers beside a moped rental stand beside the platform. MONDAVARIOUS approaches a podium and microphone on the altar. He is a genuinely spooky bald man with a goatee in the shape of an arrow. He wears mystical flowing purple robes, and he has a large key hanging from his belt. ZARKOS stands by Mondavarious’s side. Zarkos is a huge Mexican ex-wrestler, bare-chested but for crossed suspenders. A mask covers the upper half of his face. Mondavarious, stilted and detached, reads a speech.

dialogues.speaker: MONDAVARIOUS
dialogues.text: Welcome to Spooky Island. My name is Mondavarious. Locked away in my castle of horrors -- Mondavarious motions toward the colorful fiberglass castle on the mountain.

dialogues.speaker: MONDAVARIOUS
dialogues.text: I have dedicated my life to the study of demonology and have found demons to be very... He turns to the next page.

dialogues.speaker: MONDAVARIOUS
dialogues.text: Frightening. I would like to introduce my bodyguard. His name is Zarkos. You may recognize him from Telemundo as the famous masked wrestler, Zarkos. Good luck. I hope your stay here is a horrifying one. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Mondavarious starts to leave, then stops and stares out at the crowd. He says this one thing with feeling:

dialogues.speaker: MONDAVARIOUS
dialogues.text: Oh, and be sure to return to your lodgings by midnight. Demons prowl the forest after midnight, in search of fresh, young souls. Mondavarious grins.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: jumps into Shaggy’s arms, shivering.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Remons!

dialogues.speaker: NATIVES
dialogues.text: stand in filed lines on the circular platform. Flames shoot up from the bowl in the center of the platform. Drummers drum beside the platform. The Natives do a synchronized dance. They chant a strange, unearthly song:

dialogues.speaker: NATIVES
dialogues.text: A ringio a wado set Ba bingam tom anani fett Ree kimio an rako ling This is what we demons sing. An enormous, diaphanous demon goddess appears in the flame. She has an evil hawk’s head and the body of a voluptuous woman. She wails a siren song. The college students step back in awe.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY AND SHAGGY
dialogues.text: scream. This time Shaggy jumps in Scooby’s arms.

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: Look, you chickens. There’s a holographic camera placed -- Velma points out cameras projecting the "Demon Goddess" into the center of the flame. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: There. And there. And there. It’s just an optical illusion.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Oh. Hal! Holograph! Shaggy and Scooby giggle and poke each other for being fraidy cats. Daphne is showing the moped rental guy the picture of Isabel. He shakes his head. She turns towards the others.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: No one recognizes Shaggy’s cousin.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: We should head up to this Mondavarious fellow’s castle. Seems the most likely place to hide a hypno-wheel.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Ro rastles!

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: We don’t do castles!

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Because castles have paintings with eyes that watch you and knight’s armor that’s a statue but there’s a guy inside who follows you every time you turn around!

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Oh, come on, Shaggy! How many times has that happened?

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Twelve! I’m not gonna do it.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Scooby --

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Ruh-uh!

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Shag-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: No_way!

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: The castle will have food.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Rood?

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: You think it has food? Because I didn’t, you know, eat any dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four MOPEDS ZOOM uphill, ramping up into the air. Scooby and Shaggy share a moped. Scooby drives, exhilarated. Shaggy holds on for dear life.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Slow down, Scooby! I think a little pee just came out of me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Velma, Daphne, and Fred SCREECH sideways to a stop, all in a clear line in front of the Disneyesque castle. Scooby tries to do the exact same thing, but his moped runs into the rest and they all fall down like dominoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang stands on the castle porch. Velma presses a DOORBELL. It plays a CHEESY MELODY. Scooby and Shaggy are frightened. Fred is excited.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: A hypno-wheel could be our biggest coup since we teamed up with the Harlem Globetrotters and opened a can of whoop-ass on Redbeard’s ghost! No one answers the door.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: No one’s here. Let’s go. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: Let’s see if the door is unlocked. Scooby, try the door.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Rhy re?

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: Because if a demon tears your head off, we'll have a warning. Scooby-Doo whines, holding up his limp paw. Shaggy pulls a Scooby snack from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Will you it for a Scooby snack? Scooby brightens. He opens his mouth wide. Shaggy throws one up in the air and Scooby catches it. Scooby gags. The snack is caught in his throat. A panicked Shaggy gives him the Heimlich maneuver. Daphne, fed up, turns the doorknob herself. It’s open. She walks inside. Scooby coughs up the snack. It propels into a small moat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others enter behind Daphne. The castle interior contrasts the phoney exterior; it’s decorated in a colorful, suburban way: shag carpeting, flowered wallpaper.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Zoinks. Not quite what I expected.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Rive re another Rooby Rack!

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: The rest are in my suitcase. Scooby makes a face as if Shaggy killed his mother.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Okay, let’s split up and look for clues. Daphne, you and I -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: I don't think so, Fred. I know where your mind goes when we get trapped in a mummy’s tomb!

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Why are you all huffy? What did I ever do to you?

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: You cheated on me, Freddy, with every fan you could get your hands on! You were like a lion with impalas, looking for the ones that were wounded or too young to know any better... I’m going with Shaggy and Scooby.

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: Typical.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: Just like it always was. I was always picked last for the teams.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Teams?

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: Your little cliques. You and Fred over here, Shaggy and Scooby over there. I was always the third wheel.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Fine. Velma, come with me. I want you to. I’m very excited about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daphne runs her fingers along the books on a long bookshelf, a combination of Grisham novels, self-help tomes by Fulghum, and withered volumes on occult subjects. Scooby, beside her, can see through a doorway into a kitchen. He pokes Shaggy, and they move toward it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Daphne arrives at a book, Men Are From Mars, J am From Hell, by John Gray. She removes it. “As she does, the bookshelf twirls open, leading into a tiny room. An ancient text sits on a lectern beneath a single lamp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred and Velma walk along a wall with framed photos of Anne Geddes’ babies.

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: We can split up now. It was nice of you to pretend. But I know you'd have rather gone with the other guys. (beat) It’s because I’m ugly, isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Velm! No. Heck, stocky chicks turn me on every now and again. Velma glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: What? That was a compliment. They pass a picture of a kid dressed up like a cabbage. Its eyes follow them, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daphne eyes the heavily-bound text. It reads, in gold: Daemon Ritus. She opens it to reveal Latin text on parched, crumbling pages, hundreds of years old. Some passages are marked in yellow highlighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaggy and Scooby are covered in food from the refrigerator and cabinets. Shaggy swallows a sardine, and burps. Scooby-Doo chuckles. He copies Shaggy, letting out a small burp. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Shaggy laughs, too. He rolls back his head and burps obnoxiously loud. ~ Scooby yanks on his own tail, pretending this triggers a drawn-out belch. Shaggy slaps the back of his head and makes a burp fall into his hand, clutching it. He opens his hand and lets the burp out of his hand (burping again). Scooby concentrates, squinting one eye. He FARTS.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Ha! You asked for it! Shaggy sticks his butt to the side. He works hard at pushing out a long, uneven-sounding FART. Daphne enters the kitchen doorway behind Shaggy, holding Daemon Ritus. Shaggy doesn’t see her. Scooby slices his finger across his throat in a "cut it out" gesture.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: I don’t think so! I’m not stopping till all your fur is singed off! Shaggy cracks up as he continues to pass an inhuman amount of gas. Scooby pointing surreptitiously behind Shaggy. Shaggy, still laughing and farting, looks behind him Daphne stares at him. Shaggy’s smile disappears. His FART STOPS mid-sound.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: I thought we were trying to save your cousin.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Right. That wasn’t me... That was, um, the, um... plumbing? Scooby cracks up.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: I found this weird book. Daphne plops the Daemon Ritus on the counter. Scooby and Shaggy peer at it over Daphne’s shoulder.  40.

dialogues.speaker: PAGE
dialogues.text: Beneath the yellow highlighted text on parched paper, is an illustration of thousands of demons rushing down as humans scream in horror.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Rake a rood R-rirt.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Yeah! It would make a good T- shirt.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: You guys. She turns the page. Scooby and Shaggy love it.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Oooh! Rool! Whoa!

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: It’s a demon eating a baby’s head!

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Yeah, but you put like, you know, a band name over it. They hear a DOOR UNLOCKING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mondavarious and Zarkos enter hurriedly.

dialogues.speaker: ZARKOS
dialogues.text: Two went this way! The others, el cocina!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zarkos and Mondavarious move swiftly down the hallway. They move past three large Ming vases. After they pass them, Daphne, Shaggy, and Scooby stick their heads out of them.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Come on! They start to get out of them. Shaggy panics; his shoulders are lodged in the vase. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: I’m stuck! Scooby runs away. Daphne tries to pull Shaggy out, but is unable.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Crap! Scooby, where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zarkos and Mondavarious enter. Food is all over the kitchen. The Daemon Ritus is on the counter. | Mondavarious runs his finger along the binding. The highlighted pages have been torn away. He turns to Zarkos.

dialogues.speaker: MONDAVARIOUS
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you stop them?

dialogues.speaker: ZARKOS
dialogues.text: I did. They just don’t know it yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred and Velma are on their mopeds as Scooby gets on his. Daphne rolls the Ming vase with Shaggy in it out the front door.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Oh, we just thought it’d be fun to roll Shaggy around in a vase.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Why now? !

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: She's kidding.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Oh. Daphne closes her eyes. She makes a humming sound. She slowly pulls back her fist. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: What’s she doing?! I think-she’s gonna hit me!

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: She’s summoning her chi. Daphne’s fist flies forward, SHATTERING the VASE, without touching Shaggy. He’s relieved not to be hurt.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Thanks, Daph. Daphne smiles. Nods. Straddles her moped.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Let’s all meet back at the hotel. Daphne, Fred, and Velma take off. Shaggy gets on the moped behind Scooby.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Scooby, you totally abandoned me!

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Rorry. Scooby kick-STARTS his ENGINE. Beside his kickstand, a hole has been poked into the gas tank. Gas streams out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred, Velma, and Daphne zip by, down the steep hill. Shaggy and Scooby are behind them, but their moped is puttering and slowing. Finally, it stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A brightly-lit hotel in the middle of the dark forest. Fred, Velma, and Daphne are entering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Fred, Velma, and Daphne come through the door, they’re almost toppled by two giggling students in their underwear, chasing and spraying shaving cream on each other. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: We'll reconvene here at eight~“in the morning. Velma and Daphne nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Velma sits down at a bar beside a longhaired METAL HEAD. She looks at the bartender.

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: A Coca-Cola please. The bartender sets her up with Coke in a glass.

dialogues.speaker: METAL HEAD
dialogues.text: You’re the one I saw talking to those Mystery Ink guys! You know them? Velma stares at him. On her other side, a mischievous student pours vodka into her Coke. She doesn’t see. She takes a sip of her Coke. She is surprised by its tasty quality. She takes another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby and Shaggy stand beside the dead moped.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Re’re out of ras.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: I guess we like have to walk, man. We better hope we don’t have fresh, young souls, Scoob! Shaggy laughs loudly. Scooby snickers with vigor. Shaggy laughs a little quieter. Scooby laughs quieter. Shaggy stops laughing. Scooby does too. Shaggy’s mouth is a flat line. Scooby is also not amused. INT. DAPHNE’S HOLIDAY INN ROOM Daphne unpacks her suitcase, which lies open on her bed. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She removes an eggplant and pink body suit on a hanger. There’s a KNOCK at the door.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Hold on! Daphne opens the door. Hey, it’s Fred. He smiles mischievously as he leans against the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Shaggy and Scooby show up?

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Velma’s waiting for them in the bar downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A drunken Velma is held aloft by a cadre of students. She whoops as she swirls her turtleneck sweater over her head. BACK TO DAPHNE’S ROOM

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: They’re probably with her by now. You find any evidence of a hypno- wheel?

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: No. But I think Mondavarious may take demons more seriously than he lets on.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: You’re saying you believe there’s actual demonic activity on this island?

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: No... But... Fred starts to enter.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: We have adjoining rooms. I’11 leave my side unlocked. Daphne puts her hand on his chest, stopping him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: You think we’re going to share rooms?!

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: We have a long history.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: So do Godzilla and King Kong. But that doesn’t mean they should have sex.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Come on... I miss you.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: I want nothing to do with you, Freddy!

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: We fit together like Legos!

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Back then, right. When I was always pretending --

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Pretending?

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: That I was weak and that you were strong and that you were smarter than me! So you’d like me, Fred! All right? Fred snickers.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: You don’t believe me?!

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Wellll --

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Remember when the cheddar cheese ghost captured me?!

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: You think I thought he was real? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: You were terrified -- -

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: He_ had cheddar cheese for a head! I let him capture me, so you could save me. ‘Oh, help! Help!’ Give me a break! And I’1l tell you, that wasn’t the only thing I faked!

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Slow down!

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: But I’m over the co-dependent damsel-in-distress crap. All right? I don’t want you. I don’t like you. And that ‘ascot’? It makes you look gay. Daphne shuts the door in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred stands in front of Daphne’s closed door. He’s speechless for a moment. Then:

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: That thing on your head... that... barrette... headband... maybe... Maybe that makes you look gay! Did you ever think of that?! A maid passes by. Fred smiles at her, embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: I couldn’t think of anything better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby-Doo and a bedraggled Shaggy wend their way up through the forest. Scooby trails a few feet behind. Eerie trees loom over them like phantoms.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: My bones are aching. My feet are tired. And my soul is guessing it’s past midnight. Heh. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Scooby spots a frog. He playfully tries to slap his paw down on the frog. The frog leaps into the woods. Scooby bounds off after it, disappearing into the trees.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: You know what I’m saying, Scoob? Shaggy turns toward Scooby. He’s not there.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Scoob?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaggy maneuvers between trees and into the darker woods.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Scooby-Doo, where are you?! BUSHES RUSTLE beside Shaggy. Relieved, he moves toward the RUSTLING.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Like, what are you doing, man? You’re always messing around, when we're supposed to -- Shaggy separates the branches. Instead of Scoob, he sees: SHAGGY’S POV A humongous slit pair of eyes in the darkness, a striking combination of flesh, flames, and black embers.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The flaming eyes spring toward Shaggy. Shaggy runs. The eyes jounce behind him, toward him. Shaggy stumbles into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby-Doo is here, chasing the frog in circles, trying to paw it. Shaggy looks behind him. The eyes are no longer there. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Raggy, a rog! -

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Go!

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Rhy? Scooby sees the flaming eyes appear over Shaggy’s head. Scooby-Doo screams at the top of his lungs. Shaggy sees the eyes. He screams. The frog sees the eyes. The frog screams. The frog hops into the brook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaggy and Scooby shriek like girls as they dash away. They spot the lit Holiday Inn as they make their way to the edge of the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby yanks on the handle.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: It‘s rocked! They slam their fists on the door.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Help! Open up! Relp! Scooby notices a BUZZER and intercom. He presses it.

dialogues.speaker: INTERCOM GUY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Ret rus in!

dialogues.speaker: INTERCOM GUY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Rs ns are in rill us!

dialogues.speaker: INTERCOM GUY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What do you, got a dead jellyfish in your mouth?! Sober up, jack! The rules are no one in past midnight. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Scooby, panicked, takes a running start and flails himself painfully into the front door. ~ Shaggy sees the eyes stagger toward them. He can make eut its gigantic shape.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Yes, we're sorry. We apologize. We've been bad -- but let us in, you pinhead, it’s about to tear our fresh, young souls from our bodies!

dialogues.speaker: INTERCOM GUY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (mumb1ing) Well... as long as you admit you’ve been bad. The BUZZER BUZZES. Scooby and Shaggy fling open the door. They throw themselves inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaggy and Scooby slam the door shut. They lock the door. They turn and see: Numerous students in the lobby, watching. Some are gathered on the second floor stairwell, looking down to see what all the commotion is about. The Metal Head and Velma are in front. Velma is sloshed.

dialogues.speaker: METAL HEAD
dialogues.text: Why were you dudes banging on the door like a bunch of whiny little wusses?

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: Thcooby. Doo! You know what Doo ith? Itsth another name for Poop. Your name ith Scooby...Poop! Shaggy and Scooby push furniture in front of the front door to block it.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Velma, it’s a demon!

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: Ith a man in a mathk. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: That’s a pretty good theory except for one thing. What?

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: They have fire instead of eyes! Velma clutches the Metal Head’s shoulder, about to cry.

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: Thith ith my betht frien. Shaggy looks around the room for things to use as weapons.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: We need a plan! How ‘bout we... like, we fashion, like, a giant crossbow out of the strings of that -- that grand piano...

dialogues.speaker: METAL HEAD
dialogues.text: Baby grand.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Baby grand, right... And a, like... Shaggy spies a tall, upright halogen lamp.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: A halogen lamp as an arrow! The Metal Head looks at him like he’s an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby sits melancholily in a corner with cushy seats and a standing ashtray. Scooby enters, panicked.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Red Red Red!

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Hey, Scoob. Buddy.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Ronster raised re roo de rorest! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: That was you slamming on the door? _ Scooby nods. Fred stands, fed up.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Man, this is the most embarrassing thing you’ve done since you decided to clean your crotch at Don Knotts’ Christmas party! (aside) Not that I wasn’t envious of your elasticity. Scooby gnashes his teeth and walks like a monster.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Ronster! Rig! Ranted to real Rooby-Doo’s roull

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: How many times do I have to say it? There are no such entities as ghosts, ghouls, goblins, or monsters! At the end of every paranormal claim there are only fools seeking fame, paranoid imaginations, or charlatans looking to make a buck! There is absolutely -- absolutely -- no such thing as magi--

dialogues.speaker: ENORMOUS DEMON
dialogues.text: twelve feet tall, SMASHES through the WINDOW. His eyes are flames. His flattened head sinks into his monstrously muscular body. His horrible claws are three feet long. His body is raw, pink, verrucose, and protoplasmic. It’s safe to say this is no man in a mask. The demon picks Fred up in its huge claws and smashes him against the wall, knocking him unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another demon kicks in the front DOOR, SHATTERING it. The pieces knock Velma down; her glasses fly off. The demon, partially visible in the doorway, lets out an incredibly loud, piercing shriek, a noise seemingly surging directly from the bowels of Hell. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: College students scream, flee in terror. Scooby-Doo enters, galloping out of the bar.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOBY
dialogues.text: Raggagagyyyyyy ! Five screeching demons chase out of the bar after him. Shaggy looks around the room, realizing something.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: We don’t have enough halogen lamps! We don’t have enough halogen lamps at all! Demons smash furniture and pick up college students. Some demons breathe a green mist on the students, a kind of gas that promptly knocks the students unconscious. Others slam students against the walls, a quicker job of it. They fling the unconscious youths over their shoulders. They move onto the next victim. Velma runs her fingers over the carpet, searching for her specs.

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: My glathes, My glathes! VELMA’S POV Vague blob shapes; then, her cracked glasses are handed to her.

dialogues.speaker: VELMA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Thankth. That’th...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Velma stands, putting on her glasses. She looks to see who gave them to her. It’s a grinning demon.

dialogues.speaker: VELMA
dialogues.text: Jinkies. The demon picks her up. He breathes green mist on her.  53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby-Doo flies into the room behind the front desk. Visitors’ luggage is piled here, waiting to be brought to the proper room. Some demons pass through the hall behind him, unaware of him. Scooby digs through the suitcases, tossing one out of the way after the other. He arrives at an olive suitcase with flower stickers. He throws it open. It’s filled with brown corduroys and green shirts. He throws aside the clothes, searching in panic. Then he finds what he’s looking for. He smiles. It’s the pack of Scooby Snacks Garret gave him. Shrieking demons burst through the doorway behind him. Scooby tosses a comb at them. As you might imagine, this does little good. He clutches the Scooby Snack bag in his mouth. He barrels away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daphne eats yogurt in bed. A very LOUD HONG KONG ACTION MOVIE on TV drowns out the commotion below. She hears a KNOCK at her door.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Fred! Didn’t I tell you -- She walks to the door. Opens it. Shaggy looks like a maniac. The extremity of the situation has pushed him into a nervous, quiet numbness.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Shaggy? He puts his finger to his lips.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Shbh. (whispering, pointing downstairs) Demons eating people.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Demons what? Shaggy pushes her inside. He softly shuts the door. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: We'll jump out the window. - Shaggy totters to the window.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: What?! Shaggy, you’re being a weirdo. Get out of my room! Shaggy pulls up the shade. He peers outside.

dialogues.speaker: DEMONS
dialogues.text: cling to the bricks, crawling up the side of the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Window’s out.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: walks to the front door. He opens it and peeks outside.

dialogues.speaker: DEMON
dialogues.text: is SMASHING into rooms along the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: That way’s no good either. Shaggy notices some suitcase straps on the bed. Picks one up. Begins typing it.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: I’1l make two nooses. We’1ll hang you first. I’11 make sure you're dead. This way like at least they won’t get our souls.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Fine. If you don’t leave, then I will! Daphne tosses the door open, and moves into...  55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daphne sees the demon. He looks up at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daphne slams the door shut, locking it. She’s speechless. Shaggy nods and smiles in understanding. A demon’s arm SMASHES through the WINDOW. The other demon kicks in the front door. Daphne back-flips next to the doors that lead from room to room. She opens the first door.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Daphne! No! Grab a noose! Those doorways are only open on one side! Daphne grabs the knob to the second door. She swings it open. It’ Fred’s room.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Thank God Freddy’s a scumbucket. A demon is about to grasp Shaggy. Shaggy dives after Daphne into Fred’s room. INT. FRED‘S HOTEL ROOM Shaggy locks the door behind him. The demon SLAMS his FIST through the DOOR. It SPLINTERS. Daphne dashes through the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Daphne enters the hall, she finds herself facing another huge demon. Daphne quickly closes her eyes, thrusts her firsts out, starts humming and summoning her chi. The demon pokes her in the forehead with his huge finger, knocking her out. He slings her over his shoulder. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Shaggy runs into the hall. He sees Shaggy over the demon’s shoulder. The demon slinks down the hall like an ape. Shaggy grabs Daphne’s forearm. He yanks. She slides off the demon and into Shaggy’s arms. Shaggy runs down the hall cradling her. The demon turns, sees Shaggy with Daphne, and takes chase. Scooby appears, running up the stairwell with the Scooby Snacks (TM) in his mouth. His path converges with Shaggy.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Scooby? What are you do -- ? Tens of demons rush up the stairwell behind Scooby. Shaggy, carrying Daphne, and Scooby run down the hall together. The horde of SCREECHING DEMONS chases them. A window is at the end of the hall. Scooby leaps toward the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby-Doo’s gargantuan body CRASHES majestically through the GLASS. Shaggy with Daphne flies out behind him. They plummet twenty feet. They land on a long awning overhanging the rear recreational area of the hotel. They slide down it, spinning, and are flung splashing into the hotel swimming pool. The demons leap out the open window after them. But they’re too heavy to slide down the awning. They tear through the fabric and land painfully on the hard concrete. Scooby and Shaggy and a walking Daphne pull themselves out of the pool. The demons are far behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby and Shaggy are hidden behind a large boulder. They’re peeking around it. Daphne is pacing nervously.  57.

dialogues.speaker: DEMONS
dialogues.text: in the distance, head in a single file away from the Inn. Unconscious students are slung over their shoulders. The Inn itself is in terrible condition, with shattered ‘windows, doors, and huge holes in walls.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: They can’t see us. I guess we’re safe for the time being.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Alrighty. So we need to figure out a way to defeat the demons, and then save Fred and Velma.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: That’s sort of like my plan, which was get the heck out of here and let the demons eat Fred and Velma. Scooby opens his bag of Scooby Snacks (TM). The bag is filled with water. He chews one and gets a sour expression. He looks at Shaggy, who is dialing his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: You can’t eat those. They’re soaked in chlorine. This upsets Scooby. A single tear falls down his face.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Calling the cops.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Wait! We don’t need the police! Fred and Velma always figured out everything! Now it’s our turn! For the first time they’re the damsels in distress, not me!

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Daphne, you just were the damsel in distress. I saved you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daphne’s lip quivers with this realization. She slumps to the ground, against the boulder.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Oh... crap. It’s my destiny. I’m trapped in an endless, vicious cycle of being captured and saved. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: (into phone) - I‘d like to report like a kidnapping. (to Daphne) Get some rest. We’1ll wait here. Scooby eats his Scooby Snacks with a disgusted look on his face, weeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun peeks over the tropical fun park, bleaching away the terror of the night before.

dialogues.speaker: RAIMONDO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You the ones called in the kidnapping?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaggy and Daphne blink themselves awake. Hardbitten LIEUTENANT RAIMONDO and fresh-faced OFFICER FITZGIBBON stand over them. Scooby is writing something on the rock.

dialogues.speaker: RAIMONDO
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Emilio Raimondo, U.S. Coast Guard. This is Officer Fitzgibbon.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: I'm Daphne Blake. Shaggy Rogers. Scooby pokes Raimondo. He points at an equation he’s written in the dust of the rock. 12 +7

dialogues.speaker: RAIMONDO
dialogues.text: Way off. Raimondo readies his notebook.

dialogues.speaker: RAIMONDO
dialogues.text: So what’s up? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: Like last night there were thése demons here and they like smashed up the hotel! Raimondo looks beyond the boulder at the Holiday Inn. It’s in perfect condition. The shattered windows, smashed doors, and tattered awnings are now new and clean. Shaggy stares at it in shock. He moves toward it.

dialogues.speaker: RAIMONDO
dialogues.text: Looks all right now.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: They must have, like, come back and cleaned it up. They were like eighteen feet tall!

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Shaggy, please... Lieutenant, we're not just some crazy -- Shaggy taps Raimondo’s notebook.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: And they had eyes that were fire! Write that down. A wholesome couple, happy and in perfect condition, walk out of the hotel. Shaggy and Daphne stare, unnerved.

dialogues.speaker: RAIMONDO
dialogues.text: Who, by name, has disappeared?

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Our friends, Velma Dinkley and Fred Jones.

dialogues.speaker: SHAGGY
dialogues.text: And every other guest here... except... I guess... those two. Another twenty students emerge from the hotel, laughing, prepared for a day of fun in the sun. All the students -- once punks, burnouts, and hippies -- are now clean- cut. Daphne, Shaggy, and Scooby are shocked. N’Goo, the albino, approaches the Coast Guard. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: N‘ GOO Officers, is there’s a problem of some sort here?

dialogues.speaker: RAIMONDO
dialogues.text: These folks claim their friends were abducted last night. N’Goo laughs.

dialogues.speaker: RAIMONDO
dialogues.text: What’s so funny? N’ GOO They have obviously mistooken our Monster Show for something from their real lives!

dialogues.speaker: RAIMONDO
dialogues.text: ‘Monster Show’? N’ GOO I must never pass up opportunities to show the local constabulary a demonstration of our very frightening presentation! Come!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: N’Goo, the Coast Guard, Shaggy, Scooby, and Daphne stand in the lobby. It is also in pristine condition. N’GOO At the time of midnight, the show begins here. The kids are hanging out. They are having the fun times. Then, all of the sudden: A "DEMON" bursts out of the closet. It’s a man of normal height in a worn, torn costume, a very poor approximation of the demons the night before. A zipper runs down its back. Its blinking red eyes are fashioned from Christmas lights.

dialogues.speaker: "DEMON"
